intro: Elatostema benguetense, commonly known as the Benguet Elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related species. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
